00022 /**
00023  * @file   SelfCreate.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Tue Oct 25 17:10:41 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Small interface for functions that know how to make an instance of
00028  * themselves given a map of key, value parameters. Idea is that you can call
00029  * this class's static methods generically and cast appropriately.
00030  * 
00031  */
00032 #ifndef _SELFCREATE_H_
00033 #define _SELFCREATE_H_
00034 
00035 //
00036 #include "chipstream/SelfDoc.h"
00037 //
00038 #include <cstring>
00039 #include <map>
00040 #include <string>
00041 #include <vector>
00042 //
00043 
00044 /**
00045  * Small interface for functions that know how to make an instance of themselves
00046  * given a map of key, value parameters. Idea is that you can call this class's
00047  * static methods generically and cast appropriately.
00048  */
00049 class SelfCreate { 
00050 
00051 public:
00052 
00053   /**
00054    * @brief virtual destructors for virtual class.
00055    */
00056   virtual ~SelfCreate() {};
00057 
00058   /** 
00059    * @brief Take a string of from "name.param1=value1.param2=value2" and populate the
00060    * name and paramMap objects with it.
00061    * @param spec String description of name and parameters.
00062    * @param name Will contain name after call.
00063    * @param paramMap Parameter key/value pairs will be filled in.
00064    */
00065   static void fillInNameParam(const std::string &spec, std::string &name, 
00066                               std::map<std::string, std::string> &paramMap);
00067 
00068   /** 
00069    * @brief Check the proposed parameters in query against the allowed
00070    * in gold. Specifically checks to make sure all of the keys in
00071    * allowed are keys in gold.
00072    * 
00073    * @param query Proposed key/value pairs for parameters.
00074    * @param gold Allowed key/description pairs for parameters.
00075    * @param badParam Vector filled with keys for param found to be bad.
00076    * 
00077    * @return true if all keys in query are keys in gold, false otherwise
00078    */
00079   static bool validParam(const std::map<std::string,std::string> &query,
00080                          SelfDoc &doc,
00081                          std::vector<std::string> &badParam);
00082 
00083   /// Makes for some nice syntactic sugar. 
00084   typedef SelfCreate *(*selfCreator)(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00085 
00086   /** 
00087    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00088    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00089    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00090    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00091    * 
00092    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00093    * 
00094    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00095    */
00096   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00097 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00098     (param); /* unused. */
00099 #endif
00100     return NULL;
00101   }
00102 
00103   /** 
00104    * Is there a match in this SelfDoc vector for a the specification provided? In other
00105    * words should this set of SelfDoc objects be trying to construct this specification.
00106    * 
00107    * @param spec - String specification of object requested.
00108    * @param docs - Vector of selfdoc objects to look in for name of object to be made.
00109    * 
00110    * @return true if there is a valid match for this specification in these docs, false otherwise
00111    */
00112   static bool canMake(const std::string &spec, std::vector<SelfDoc> &docs);
00113 
00114   /** 
00115    * @brief Create an object requested by the specification string by matching
00116    * it against the self documenting classes and then calling the matching self
00117    * creator function. Resulting object must be delete'd when done.
00118    * @param spec - String specification of object requested.
00119    * @param docs - Vector of selfdoc objects to look in for name of object to be made.
00120    * @param creators - Vector of creation functions to use for creating object.
00121    * @param typeDescription - What type of object are we attempting to make?
00122    * @param error - If true call errAbort when don't recognize value, otherwise return NULL.
00123    * @return Pointer to new SelfCreate object, delete when finished.
00124    */
00125   static SelfCreate *selfCreateFromString(const std::string &spec, std::vector<SelfDoc> &docs,
00126                                           std::vector<SelfCreate::selfCreator> &creators, 
00127                                           const std::string &typeDescription, bool error=true);
00128   
00129   /** 
00130    * Chop up a string into a vector of words separated by '.' while trying to
00131    * respect floating point digits.
00132    * 
00133    * @param s - string of interest.
00134    * @param words - vector to put words into, will be cleared then filled.
00135    */
00136   static void chopStringWithFloats(const std::string &s, std::vector<std::string> &words);
00137 
00138   static void setValue(std::string name, std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, SelfDoc &doc) {
00139     std::map<std::string,std::string>::iterator iter;
00140     SelfDoc::Opt &opt = doc.getDocOption(name);
00141     iter = param.find(name);
00142     if(iter != param.end()) {
00143       opt.value = iter->second;
00144     }
00145           if (!opt.type == SelfDoc::Opt::String)
00146           {
00147                   // Strip surrounding single quotes.
00148                   if ((opt.value.length() > 2) && (opt.value[0] == '\'') && (opt.value[opt.value.length() - 1] == '\''))
00149                   {
00150                           opt.value.assign(opt.value.substr(1, opt.value.length() - 2));
00151                   }
00152           }
00153     if(!opt.checkOption()) {
00154       Err::errAbort("SelfCreate::setValue() - '" + opt.value + "' is not a valid value for parameter: '" + name + "'. The specified range is " + opt.minVal + " to " + opt.maxVal);
00155     }
00156   }
00157 
00158   static void fillInValue(int &value, std::string name, std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, SelfDoc &doc) {
00159     setValue(name, param, doc);
00160     SelfDoc::Opt &opt = doc.getDocOption(name);
00161     value = opt.asInt();
00162   }
00163 
00164   static void fillInValue(double &value, std::string name, std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, SelfDoc &doc) {
00165     setValue(name, param, doc);
00166     SelfDoc::Opt &opt = doc.getDocOption(name);
00167     value = opt.asDouble();
00168   }
00169 
00170   static void fillInValue(float &value, std::string name, std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, SelfDoc &doc) {
00171     setValue(name, param, doc);
00172     SelfDoc::Opt &opt = doc.getDocOption(name);
00173     value = opt.asFloat();
00174   }
00175 
00176   static void fillInValue(bool &value, std::string name, std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, SelfDoc &doc) {
00177     setValue(name, param, doc);
00178     SelfDoc::Opt &opt = doc.getDocOption(name);
00179     value = opt.asBool();
00180   }
00181 
00182   static void fillInValue(std::string &value, std::string name, std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, SelfDoc &doc) {
00183     setValue(name, param, doc);
00184     SelfDoc::Opt &opt = doc.getDocOption(name);
00185     value = opt.asString();
00186   }
00187     
00188 };

00190 #endif /* _SELFCREATE_H_ */
